Richard Maass Westchester and New York State History Collection
Subseries B: Richard Maass' Transcriptions and Notes
Subseries B: Richard Maass' Transcriptions and Notes

This subseries, held in boxes 17 through 19, holds transcriptions and notes made by Richard Maass regarding the materials contained in and separated from Series V subseries A. No container list has been made for this subseries.

Box 17 contains materials regarding The Boston Chronicle, The Boston Gazette and Country Journal, The Caledonian Mercury, The Columbian Centinel, The Connecticut Courant, The Connecticut Journal, The Connecticut Observer, The Continental Journal, Drewby's Derby Mercury, Dunlap's Pennsylvania Packet, The Edinburgh Advertiser, Essex Gazette, Essex Journal, Essex Register, The Exeter Watchman, The Freeman's Journal, The Gazetteer, Gentleman's Magazine, and Gazette de France (January 1776 - February 1783). One folder, labeled "The Boston Chronicle Dec. 26 1768 and Other Xeroxes," also contains transcriptions and photocopies of correspondence located in Series I.

Box 18 contains materials regarding Gazette de France (March 1783 - December 1783), The Glasgow Mercury, The Independent Chronicle, The Independent Ledger, Lloyd's Evening Post, London Chronicle, London Gazette, Maryland Journal, The Morning Post and Daily Advertiser, The National Intelligencer and Washington Advertiser, New England Chronicle, New England Galaxy, The New England Palladium, New Jersey Gazette, New York Packet, Niles' Weekly Register, Pennsylvania Evening Post, Pennsylvania Gazette, Pennsylvania Journal Supplement, The Pennsylvania Ledger, The Pennsylvania Packet, Providence Gazette, St. James Chronicle, The Salem Gazette, Town and Country, and Ephemera (Printed Materials).
Box 19 contains materials regarding "Nouvelles Extraordinaires de Divers Endroits."
